summary: The Convenient Contraception Act (H.R. 2529) aims to amend the Public Health Service Act to require group health plans and health insurance providers to allow enrollees to obtain a 365-day supply of contraceptives. The bill specifies the Secretary of Health and Human Services, the Secretary of Labor, and the Secretary of the Treasury to conduct outreach to inform individuals and healthcare providers about this benefit. The change would apply to plan years starting on or after January 1, 2026.
